cyclone.name: FRANKLIN
cyclone.current_location: about 270 mi SSW of San Juan, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: moving WNW for about a day, then forecast to make a sharp turn north toward Hispaniola (Dominican Republic ‑ Haiti) by mid-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern coast of Hispaniola (Dominican Republic / Haiti)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch in effect for the entire south coast of Hispaniola from the Haiti border eastward to Isla Saona
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Eastern and central Caribbean, especially south-central Hispaniola; lesser impacts possible Puerto Rico and U.S. Virgin Islands
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤3%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusty squalls possible as bands brush the area.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for St. Croix; only minor near-shore wave run-up possible.
weather_observation.rainfall: Showers and squalls Monday–Tuesday could produce 2–4 inches locally, with isolated higher pockets.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and rip currents in the Caribbean passages surrounding St. Croix may disrupt small-craft and ferry operations.
